creditline: Gift of David L. and Mary M.D. Parker
markings: 'Barbershop, Frogtown, 1994 Wing Young Huie', in pencil, verso, LLC; '28', in pencil, verso, center; '1', in pencil, verso, ULC
text: Wing Young Huie spent two years photographing Frogtown, a neighborhood in St. Paul, Minnesota. He was especially drawn to its increasingly diverse population of Asian, Black, and white residents. Huie developed a project that through photographs and interviews would address “the myriad realities that coexist in Frogtown, ” an area that became “like a second home” to him. Here he offers a glimpse of one of Frogtown’s barbershops, one of the many businesses that welcomed him during his time in the neighborhood.
title: Barbershop, Frogtown
